title: introduction to context engineering in llm models
description:
This course provides a foundational understanding of context engineering within large language models (LLMs), focusing specifically on the Gemini context windows. As LLMs become increasingly integral to various applications, understanding how to effectively manage and utilize context is crucial for optimizing their performance. Participants will explore the concept of context windows, how they influence model outputs, and the strategies for effectively engineering context to enhance the relevance and accuracy of generated responses. Through a combination of theoretical insights and practical examples, learners will gain a comprehensive overview of the principles and practices of context engineering in LLMs.

The course will delve into the mechanics of context windows, including their size, structure, and the implications of different configurations on model behavior. By examining case studies and engaging in hands-on exercises, participants will develop the skills necessary to manipulate context effectively, ensuring that they can leverage LLMs to their fullest potential. This course is designed for beginners, making it accessible to those new to the field while providing a solid foundation for further exploration of advanced topics in LLMs and AI-driven applications.
target_audience: This course is intended for individuals who are new to the field of artificial intelligence and large language models. It is suitable for students, professionals, and enthusiasts who wish to understand the fundamental concepts of context engineering in LLMs. No prior experience in programming or machine learning is required, making it an ideal starting point for anyone interested in exploring the capabilities of LLMs and their applications in various domains.
learning_objectives: Define context engineering and its significance in large language models.
Explain the concept of context windows and their role in LLM performance.
Identify different types of context windows and their characteristics.
Demonstrate how to manipulate context to improve model outputs.
Analyze case studies that illustrate effective context engineering strategies.
Apply learned techniques in practical exercises to enhance understanding.
Evaluate the impact of context on the relevance and accuracy of LLM responses.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of artificial intelligence concepts.
Familiarity with general programming principles is helpful but not required.

metadata.course_focus: Context engineering, context windows in LLMs, practical applications, and case studies.
